args:
It is not Lapis waiting at the ransom hand-off,
but bandits. At the same time, thugs and fiends
team up to attack the Halidom. After Karina and
the prince fight them off, she begins to sense
that something isn't quite right with him,
and soon comes up with a theory as to why.
This is where we were told\nto bring the ransom, but...
Lapis isn't here. What is going on?
I see somebody comin' right now,\nbut it sure ain't no phantom thief!
Bwa ha ha ha! Thanks for bringin' that\nthere ransom to us, princey!
I knew goin' after that opera troupe\nwas a good call!
(THEY were targeting the troupe?\nJust what is going on here?!)
...You're telling me there's a massive\nswarm of fiends approaching?!
Yep. Still a long way off, but they're\ndefinitely headed for the Halidom.
Should we suspend the performance\nand have the audience take shelter?
{player_name}?! Wait, but aren't\nyou delivering the ransom?
Bandits have hired imperial fiends in order\nto attack the opera house!
Bandits are working with the EMPIRE?\nWhat happened to Lapis?!
I don't know how Lapis is involved,\nor if she even is. But we're all in danger.
Then surely we must evacuate the patrons!
It's too late to evacuate them now—\nand if you tell them what's happening,\nit will only cause a panic.
But if we keep them all in one place,\nthey'll be easier to defend.
Karina and Giovanni, I want you to keep\nthe opera going so the audience never\nrealizes we're under attack.
Cleo? Luca? I want you in charge of\nfortifying the Halidom.
Aaand...he's gone. Okay, does anyone else\nthink he's acting super weird right now?
Something was definitely off, but I don't\nthink it's because of bad intentions...
Sorry, what are you talking about?
Probably nothing. ...All right, everyone!\nWe've got our jobs, so let's get to them!
(All I can do right now is try to charm\nthese opera fans as best I can.)
(I'll show them my kind of princess—\none who is strong and free!)
I ask the mirror for my love fortune. ♪
But the only reply is pain. ♪
(Brava, Karina... Your voice has truly\ntransformed into something special.)
(Well, I won't be outdone! My music will\ndraw the audience even further into this\nalready splendid performance!)
Big swings like that just leave ya\nwide open, pip-squeak!
Don't worry, it's the intermission—and\nGiovanni has the orchestra playing tunes\nthat are sure to keep people entranced.

So hey, what's the deal here? It's not like
you to storm off on your own—AND you
seem to be getting your butt handed to
you in the process!
Why aren't you just shapeshifting and\nblowing all these goons away?
Quit gabbin' and get to dyin'!
Another smokescreen...?\nWait, but that means you're—
Karina, we can talk later!\nWe've got enemies to deal with!
The fiends are defeated and the bandits\nsuppressed. You ready to come clean now?
I mean, I COULD ask the bandits,\nbut it'll be quicker if you just spill it.
The first thing that felt off was when\nyou were giving me encouragement.
I'm impressed, bud! That's some grade-A\ndramatic interpretation right there.
Not really. I just felt that the princess's\nfeelings were understandable.
I mean, we all can relate to wanting to\nrun away from bad circumstances.

You're a prince—you carry an entire
NATION on your shoulders. I don't think
I've ever heard you talking about a desire
to just cut and run.
That's not like {player_name}.\nNot in the slightest.
But then there was the incident with\nthe ransom money...
Hopefully we'll be able to break Bella out\nwithout having to hand this over.
I can't forgive Lapis for what she's done,\nand I want to see her brought to justice.
Righteous? Unable to forgive Lapis?\nTHAT sounds like {player_name}.
But that wasn't who came back.
That's why you ran off: so your fighting\nstyle wouldn't give you away. Our prince\nisn't exactly one for smokescreens, no?
Anyway, whenever you want to give this\ncharade up and take that disguise off\nis fine by me...
